11.content:
A bundle of energy and emotions, Chie Satonaka is the most athletic and (with the possible exception of Kanji Tatsumi) the most physical member of her investigation team. Preferring to keep her brown hair short, Chie is an avid fan of martial arts movies, and has sought to emulate them as much as possible in little "training sessions" she puts herself through each day (many under the supervision of the team's leader, Yu Narukami). On her off days she loves nothing more than to laugh with friends and enjoy some tasty steak! This has given her a very toned body, with a flat stomach, firm butt, and of course a lovely pair of legs. While her chest is the smallest out of her circle of friends (something she is no doubt painfully aware of!) her lovely and perky breasts are nothing to be scoffed at.

Under most circumstances Chie will be wearing a typical Yasogami highschool uniform, including a white and blue undershirt with the school emblem on the collar, a yellow "sailor" sash tied around her neck, and a short black skirt, and a pair of white socks and thick brown shoes (probably steal toed, as they serve as both her footwear and weapon of choice in battle). In addition, Chie has added her own touches to the outfit. Under her skirt she wears a pair of tight black exercise shorts, around her neck she wears a small necklace and she is seldom seen without her green and yellow jacket with a few whimsical buttons pinned on the outside. Out of school she likes to similarly dress in greens and yellows, sometimes equipped with colorful armbands.

Chie was a normal high school student before the mysterious murders began to plague her town of Inaba. She had heard a rumor about a so-called "Midnight Channel" that would show one who gazed into a TV at midnight their soul mate. Eager to try out the rumor, Chie incidentally began the chain of events that would lead to the formation of the investigation team. She was present for the initial "discovery" of the TV world, and was a part of the original team to save someone who had been thrown in by the mysterious killer.

Chie is in many respects the opposite to Yukiko Amagi. Where Amagi is calm, polite, and a bit withdrawn Chie is enthusiastic, impatient, and outgoing to a fault. She will be the first to rush into danger, fearless and passionate. At the same time, she seldom looks before she leaps, meaning it is often the job of the other members of team to reign in her well-meaning but occasionally shortsighted behavior. According to Chie's shadow the girl has purposefully tried to garner an impression of superiority and domination over her long time friend Yukiko to make up for her own perceived lack of feminine charms and inability to accomplish anything alone. After attaining a persona Chie sought to become more self-reliant and strong, wanting to become the protector in truth that she had always claimed to be. However, she remains extremely self-conscious about herself, especially when it comes to her body and her perceived lack of feminine qualities. No doubt this will make her impending nudity all the more mortifying.

There are other questions about herself Chie has thus far avoided thinking about. Prominent amongst them is her true feelings over Yukiko. Why was SHE specifically so very important? Was it all a matter of jealousy and manipulation on Chie's part...or something else? And what about her shadow's final "berserker" form? Did all those whips and chains, gaudy yellow leather "dominatrix" wear, and the throne made out of subordinate school girls imply some heavy handed symbolism from her subconscious? Or are there some passions Chie has yet to fully grasp about herself? Only time will tell.

The grass still tickled at her bare skin, though...especially her exposed chest. Chie took a slow breath to try and maintain her composure. Chie continued to keep still, but she kept feeling the grass as it tickled her body. Partly across her chest, but mostly along her hands and legs planted on the ground. Annoyed, she raised her hand to shake off the feeling, only to choke back a scream.

Her hand was covered in crawling ants!

"N-NNN-No, nonono," Chie squeaked, shaking her hand wildly.

While there were few things the aspiring fighter was afraid of, bugs, be they insects, arachnids, or any kind of creepy-crawly thing, were one of those things. It was bad enough normally, but bugs crawling on her in this state? Out of the question!

With the ants gone, Chie caught her breath, then lost it again when she heard a buzzing noise, followed by something landing on her buttock. "W-W-What's that?" she whimpered. Could it be a cicada? Dragonfly? Just a nasty old fly? Whatever it was Chie hoped to God that it would just leave. She was just swimming after all, why would bugs be attracted to her!?

The bug soon flew away, and Chie sighed and slowly blinked in relief. "Ha... what was I even afraid-"

Her eyes opened to see a grasshopper leaping right towards her.

"SHIT! NOOO!" she swore, falling over backwards onto her rear. Panicking, she clambored onto her feet and sprinted on the path she thought was next for her.

Unlike before, Chie was completely heedless of her surroundings as she ran. All those bugs... that was the last straw, it was time to get out of the brush!

With her legs pumping, Chie ran quite a bit more than she had intended to. This flight response, while effective at gaining distance, led to an unforeseen consequence:

11321.content:
Chie wasn't going to just lose her shoe like that. If it landed in the river that would be one thing, but just in a pack of bushes? No sweat!

Without hesitation, Chie strode directly into the bushes, and was immediately pricked and poked at by the thorns on the jagged branches of the plants.

"Ow! These things are pretty sharp," she winced, sucking her injured hand. With the thorns brushing up all around her, Chie tucked her hands into her jacket sleeves and crouched down to the ground before continuing. "Better find it fast."

Going close to the ground made it slower, but far less painful. Chie could still feel the branches tugging at her clothes as she passed by, but at least her face, arms, and legs were no longer in danger.

After a few minutes, Chie had combed the bushes, but had not found her shoe. Crawling back to the center of the thicket, she was very frustrated.

"Grr, where is it!" she yelled, throwing her head skyward.

And that, as it turned out was all she needed to do.

"Ah!" she gasped.

Her shoe had landed right in the middle of one of the bushes and was caught by its branches. Now that she knew where it was, she wasted no time in kicking it with her covered foot and putting her shoe back on her other foot.

"Well, no need to sit around here any longer," she said to herself, springing to her feet. "Time to get the heck outta here."

Eager to get out of the thorny trap as quickly as she could, she plowed on through the bushes again, not caring how much she got poked along the way, considering it yet another challenge in her path. Unfortunately, as she did so, she ended up snared in more branches than before, holding her in place.

"Argh, come on!" she yelled, forcing her way forward until soon enough she was free. Chie, seeing her shoe back with her in one piece, felt very satisfied with herself, but then blinked as she saw that the stubborn shrubberies had dealt one last parting shot. She was shocked to see that-

"Ugh. Enough! Enough! Enough!" Chie cried in frustration.

She rose up off her bed, grinding her teeth in frustration. The math book sat there, open to the latest chapter, its pages filled with incomprehensible notations and questions that had begun to blur together.

"Stupid studying! Stupid homework! Stupid brain!" Chie growled, taking her frustration out with a series of kicks aimed at her nearby punching bag.

The thin teenage girl paused a moment after the flurry of motion, breathing heavily and heart pounding. This was absolutely the worst thing she had ever experienced. Bring on berserk shadows and creepy serial killers any day! Her real opponent, the unbeatable final boss in her own personal hell of a shonen anime, was most certainly the incomprehensible school work her teachers mercilessly bombarded her with. What was worse...from what she had heard about college, mathematics only became more intricate and complicated from here. She was facing an unbeatable enemy, and this wasn't even their final form!

With a dejected sigh Chie slumped down in her chair. She'd never particularly cared for her studies this much in the past. She was well aware that academics were her weak point, and had been content to lean heavily on her long time friend Yukiko for tutoring to help her scrape through the tests when all else failed. But that of course had all been before she had met a certain Yu Narukami, before her whole world had been turned absolutely upside down with the introduction of the TV world...and of course before her self image had been rather mercilessly torn apart by her mocking inner self. Ever since Chie had been determined to stop relying (abusing, really, if her shadow was to be believed) her friend and become self sufficient! Not to mention she had a new goal and purpose in life- to join the police academy and officially protect the innocent as she had behind the scenes as a member of the Investigation Team.

So here she was, new and improved self sufficient Chie, protector of the innocent...slamming her head against the brick wall that was her math homework! Life was incredibly unfair sometimes!

"Okay. Forget this. I've been at this way too long and I'm not getting ANYWHERE anymore. Its okay to take a break for the day, right? Let my poor brain recharge just a little?" Chie asked the empty room.

Okay. But what kind of break?

Chie paused, then popped on her laptop. She found her answer in a listing of her local movie theater.

"Naked Fist III: Naked Fury! Holy crap! I had no idea they were making a new one!!"

Chie had her mission. Now the only question was....

11454.content:
AUTHOR NOTE: For obvious reasons this story is now taking place after the events of Persona 4 proper and the spinoff Persona 4 Arena/Ultimax.

"That...was...AMAZING!!" Chie squeeled with excitement as she exited the movie theater.

"Keep your voice down. There's no need to shout." Akihiko Sanada scolded. "But yeah, that was a pretty great for an action movie."

There had been an incident, not long after the investigation team had confronted and defeated the god of Inaba responsible for the existence of the TV World. The details were somewhat convoluted, involving robots and other persona users and an attempt to destroy the world. But most important, it had resulted in Chie meeting the former boxer turned lone wanderer, Akihiko. He was clearly as serious and passionate about fighting as Chie herself, and had years of experience pursuing his craft to boot. The first time Chie had laid eyes on the half naked, battle scarred fighter she knew she had found him at last. Her role model. Her hero. Her Master on the road to becoming a martial arts hero of justice!

Also, a guy trying to get into the police academy who liked fighting movies and training as much as she did! A natural companion for enjoying the epic that was the Naked Fist.

"That last fight was incredible! The way they were just wailing on the hero back and forth and just when you think he can't win....'BUT YOU SEE, BLACK SCORPION GANG, I'VE BEEN WEARING WEIGHTED CLOTHING THE ENTIRE TIME!' And then...BA-BOOSH! Whips off his clothes, and beats the crap out of em in less than a second!!"

"Mmmmm. It was impressive.. Its mostly CGI these days, of course. No doubt their stunt people could dodge a real bullet like that." Akihiko mused.

"It was still cool, though!" Chie said.

"I suppose. But in real life actually dodging something that fast doesn't leave you time to smirk at the camera. It doesn't leave you time to think at all. Its pure muscle memory. By the time your brain has a chance to think about what you did beyond pure instinct, you've already done it and counter attacked...."

"Your really that fast, master?" Chie said in awe.

"Don't call me that. But yeah. You might be too, for that matter. Training your persona helps train your body beyond what a normal person can achieve on their own. Plus, I've spent my time training up my arms and upper body. If gives me power, but also slows me down. If I was fighting someone like you on my level, your focus on your feet would probably give you a huge speed advantage."

"Whoa...you...really think so?"

"Sure. But don't get cocky. I've been training way longer than you have!"

"Yeah, but like you said, all my training goes to my legs! Those are naturally more powerful than the arms anyway since they get more exercise daily just from walking. So I'm probably already faster. No offense, Master!"

"Oh really?" Akihiko whispered.

Something to note about both Chie and her so called master. Action movies excite them, but also leave them feeling restless. Seeing super human feats done with such ease makes them think about their own training. As energetic and athletic as they are even as their default personality, the level of competition and desire to throw themselves back into their training was now at a fever pitch. In contrast, their tendency to throw themselves recklessly into an endeavor in defiance of common sense, while always a danger, was also at an all time high.

"You and me. From here to the Amagi Inn! Loser pays for our next meal at Aiya's tonight. And just to warn you, I hear its gonna be stormy in the evening. Hope you have enough for two Mega Beef Bowls, Master!" Chie proclaimed in excitement.

"Your on. Just so you know, I'm not one to hold back. I'll be looking to beat not just you, but my own best time! Put your all into it, or your going to lose!"

"Same to you!" Chie replied.

And with that, the great race of Inaba began. It would be a day the two would not forget...no matter how hard they tried.

In it there was a scene where the girl who would have been my character and her boyfriend were studying and every time she got something right he had to take something off, but every time she got something wrong she had to take something off..." Rise finished.

And if I got all four wrong I'd have to take two things off. If you guys lost everything first, then I'd win and if I lost everything first, then you'd win."

"I'm not sure about that," Chie said nervously. "But what the hey, count me in,"

"Thanks, Chie," Yukiko said warmly.

"You know, come to think of it, I think I remember seeing Yu-kun standing on that pier over there sometimes," Chie pointed to a stone dock. "Think that's his magic fishing spot?"

"Looks as good a place to me as anywhere," Yukiko shrugged.

Rod in hand, Yukiko walked over to the pier, with Chie close behind. Standing at the edge of the pier, Yukiko peered down into the mostly-clear water rushing on by. She thought she could see something swimming about. "Okay, here goes," Yukiko said, swinging back with the fishing rod and casting into the river.

"Nice," Chie said, letting out a whistle. "So, what's next?"

"I think I have to wait now, until I catch a fish?" Yukiko ventured.

"Ah, gotcha," Chie nodded.

The girls stared at the bobber intensely, waiting for something to happen. Five minutes passed. Which soon became ten, then fifteen. All without a bite.

"Ugh, we've been waiting forever. Something happen already!" Chie complained.

"That is quite odd. Which bait did you use, again?" an elderly voice popped up behind them.

"WAAH!" Chie and Yukiko screamed, with Yukiko almost dropping the rod. Glancing around, they saw an old man hunched over staring at them.

"Geez! Don't sneak up on us like that, you almost gave me a heart attack, old man!" Chie shouted.

"W-What do you want with us?" Yukiko asked.

"Your concentration's good, it seems," the old man continued, seeming to ignore Chie's outburst. "But I think there might be a problem with the bait you're using."

"Bait?" Yukiko asked.

"Just reel in your line, girl."

"Okay, okay," Yukiko complied while Chie stood on edge.

"Well, there's your problem," the old man pointed at the bare hook. "Your bait's gone and fallen off the hook. You haven't run out, have you?"

"Bait?" Yukiko asked, confused. "Chie, am I forgetting something?"

"I dunno, but maybe..." Chie shrugged.

"No bait!?" the old man stood up straight as a pole. "Is this your first time?"

"So what if it is?" Chie said, eyeing the old man with disgust.

"I thought so! Then what you two need are the basics! ..." he suddenly rambled into a long explanation about fishing before either Chie or Yukiko could say anything.

"...and that should be all you need to know, understood?" he asked.

"Uh..." Chie blinked, clearly having lost track.

"I... think I get it now," Yukiko said. Though a lot of the mechanics he mentioned such as the gauge bar, weather patterns, and Diligence escaped her, she thought that she was able to grasp the gist of what he said. "Um... you wouldn't happen to have any bait that we could use?"

"Why it just so happens I do! Ten of these aught to do you just fine for now," the old man grinned, handing Yukiko a bunch of strange meaty blobs.

"Uh, thanks..." Yukiko said, taking the pack. "So fish actually eat this..."

"Well, that's all from me, unless you need any refreshers. Oh! And if you'd like to trade me any fish you catch, I've got some nice items I can give."

"That's all right," Yukiko said. "I'm just here for the fish, really."

"Ah, spoken like a true angler. I'll leave you to it then!" he said, and shuffled off downstream along the riverbank.

"What a wierdo..." Chie said eventually.

"Yeah... though he did give us plenty of bait," Yukiko replied.

Yukiko place a piece of bait on the hook and wound up for another cast, the baited hook landing in the river with a plop.

"Now, how long do you think it will be until you-"

*whizz* the fishing line suddenly reeled.

"I-I have one!" Yukiko gasped, grabbing at the reel to start pulling it in. "It's pretty heavy!" she grunted, struggling to pull it in.

"Come on Yukiko, you can do it!" Chie cheered.

Yukiko pulled with all her might and... the line snapped!

"ACK!" Yukiko squawked, falling backwards flat on the ground.

"Yukiko!"

"I'm fine, ow..." Yukiko winced, rubbing her head. "I think I pulled a little too hard on that one."

"You sure you're gonna be okay?" Chie asked.

"I'm fine, really... Let me just get another hook,"

With line rebaited, Yukiko tried for attempt number 3.

"I've caught something!" Yukiko shouted with glee.

"All right! Remember, carefully this time."

With great care, Yukiko slowly reeled in her line. It was quite arduous, but Yukiko succeeded, reeling in... an old boot?

"What!?" said Chie.

"This just isn't fair," Yukiko grumbled, tossing the boot onto the beach behind her. "It even used my bait and everything."

"How did- wait, we probably don't want to know," Chie said, eyeing the booth with suspicion.

Yukiko sighed as she baited her hook once more. She could already see the sun start to head towards the horizon. Fishing was a lot more difficult and time-consuming than she thought it would be. She was already feeling drained; this was probably the last attempt she had in her for the day. Flinging her line into the river once more, she waited.

After a while, the telltale tug of the line was felt once more.

"I've got one! I hope this is it!" said Yukiko pulling in the line once more.

The line suddenly pulled back. She wasn't dealing with a boot this time. "Whoa!" Yukiko yelped, as she was pulled to the edge of the pier. "Ch-Chie?"

"On it!" Chie sprung up, dashed towards Yukiko, grabbed hold of her and pulled back. The struggle was great, but the pair was slowly making progress.

"Mmph! Almost there, you think?" asked Chie.

"I... I think so," said Yukiko, giving one last heave.

In the end-
12312.title: "I'm going to do some fishing."

choices: Junes.
the Tatsuhime Shrine.
123121.content:
With a mighty crash, the huge fish was pulled out of the river, thrashing about on the line. The girls were breathless for a moment.

"Yes! We did it, Yukiko!" Chie cheered, breaking the silence.

"Thanks, Chie," said Yukiko, taking in the marvel in front of her. The fish was indeed huge, its length reaching down from her neck to her knees. "This is definitely the same type of fish Yu-kun had the other day."

"It's so big," Chie said, staring longingly at the fish. "But eating it like this without cooking it first? That's crazy,"

"Well, that's the plan. Oh!" Yukiko gasped. "It's that late already?"

The sun was already low in the horizon. When did it get to be so late? Fishing really does take it out of you.

"Huh? But it feels like we barely did anything at all!" Chie said as they went back onto the shore.

"Oh, sorry Chie. I didn't mean to take up your whole day like this..." Yukiko said remorsefully. "Ah! How about you come over and I can cook this up for us to have together? It's the least I could do."

"Ah!? Uh, no, no that's fine," Chie suddenly paled. "I gotta get home and, you know, study and all that. We can walk together on the way, though."

"Oh, of course," Yukiko answered, busy with wrapping the undulating prize in newspaper she brought in her bag. She had hoped to treat her, but if she was busy, she was busy. She would just have to store it for later. Unfortunately, it seemed that the fish was too big to put inside her bag. At least not without folding or cutting it up, but that would ruin everything. "Guess I'll just carry it," she said aloud to no one in particular.

And so, pride in her head and wrapped fish in her hands, Yukiko set off for home with Chie alongside her. She noticed the telltale odor of fresh fish start to come up after they walked for a while, but she paid it no mind. As they continued through to downtown Inaba, making small talk along the way, Yukiko couldn't help shake a forboding feeling...

*Meow*

"Eh?" Yukiko gasped, turning around, seeing that a small orange cat was following her.

"Huh? Oh!" Chie turned as well. "Hey there little guy," she reached to pet the cat.

The cat shrugged off Chie's pets and meowed again, staring up at Yukiko.

"What does he want with me?" Yukiko said nervously.

"Duh, the fish," Chie said in realization.

"He can't have that, we worked hard for this!" Yukiko said, clutching the fish defensively.

"Yeah, but he looks so hungry," Chie said sympathetically. "I feel kinda guilty just leaving him to starve like this."

"But we don't have any other food to give them."

"Yeah... Oh, wait!" Chie had a sudden burst of inspiration. "Maybe you can give them some of that extra bait? The fish went for it, and cats eat fish, so maybe they'll like that too."

"Chie, that's brilliant!" Yukiko nodded. It made perfect sense after all. After a little digging around in her back, she brought forth one of the strange meaty blobs the old man gave her. "Here you go," Yukiko said, presenting it lovingly in her hand towards the cat.

The cat crept forward and gave the bait a sniff. It wrinkled its nose, seeming to flinch back, but soon leaned back in and gave the bait a lick.

*HISSSS* it went, crouching down and baring its teeth.

"Um, I don't think that worked Chie..." Yukiko grimaced. "We should just go."

*Meow* *Meow* *Meow* *Meow* *Meow*

A chorus of meows suddenly echoed around them. Instead of one cat in front of them, there were now ten cats all around them! Did that leader just send out some sort of cat signal?

"Uh, Yukiko..." Chie whispered nervously.

"Do you think they're mad?" Yukiko asked, stating the obvious.

In that instant, the cats all leapt towards Yukiko, claws and teeth bared.

"AAAAAH!" Yukiko screamed, first out in fear, then out in pain as their tiny cat claws sunk in.

"Yukiko!" Chie cried out, springing into action and pulling away at the cats.

The felines' attack was ferocious, scratching up and tearing all over Yukiko. She did her best to shake them off, but the advantage belonged to the hungry horde.

"Oh no!" Yukiko screamed. One bad grab knocked the fish out of her hands! No sooner than it hit the ground, the cats immediately detached themselves from Yukiko and clamored over the parcel, clawing away at the wrapping.

"Guess they only want the fish!" said Chie. "Let's go while they're distracted!"

"No!" Yukiko shouted.

"Yukiko, don't be stupid! They've messed you up a lot already. Do you want them to take another bite out of you!?" Chie said, pointing at Yukiko.

Yukiko glanced down at herself and couldn't help but gape. In the short time the cats had attacked her, they quickly caused a lot of superficial damage. Frankly, she looked like she had been put through a blender. Her pantyhose was severely shredded with some red lines running along her legs as well, and several rips have been made along her skirt and sweater, in addition to the buttons having been torn out of the latter. She was a complete mess.

But Yukiko just shook her head. This wasn't just about the fish to her. This whole exercise was meant to improve herself, which would be made useless if she turned away now. "I'm not giving up to this!" she yelled, and dove towards the fish.

The cats had torn away most of the newspaper and had almost reached the fish when Yukiko charged into them and picked the fish back up. "Get off!" she shouted, reclaiming the prize.

This only made the cats angrier, as they readied themselves and pounced towards Yukiko once more,

"HII-YAAA!" Chie shouted, bursting in and delivering a devastating kick to one of the cats.

*MREEOOWW* the cat cried as it was knocked far away.

"You want some of this? Bring it on!" Chie yelled, standing between Yukiko and the cats.

"Chie!" Yukiko gasped.

"Go! I'll be right behind you!" Chie said, wincing as the cats began to cling to her.

"Got it!" Yukiko replied, clutching the fish and running away, cats, Chie, and more cats in hot pursuit.

With the sun nearly fully set, not many people were out at this time. But there were still a few passersby witness to the strange cat chase. Yukiko was running fast enough to avoid getting cornered, the cats continued to leap at her and deal glancing damage to her. Unfortunately for the girls, the further they went, the more cats seemed to be joining the fight. Just how many stray cats were there in Inaba!?

By this point, Yukiko was no longer focused on running home, just on running away, and hopefully finding some shelter. Miraculously, her aimless fleeing found herself at a familiar location, which even though it wasn't the Inn, it would at least be an improvement. She found herself at-
123121.title: Yukiko catches a huge fish!

choices: Teddie.
Naoto.
1231211.content:
The large superstore stood like a beacon for Yukiko, who was hoping very much that the store was still open. Continuing her mad dash, she paused in front of the automatic doors.

*Ting* the doors opened.

"Yes, YEEE!" Yukiko squawked as a pursuing cat took the opportunity to latch onto her hip.

"Get off!" she grunted as she went inside, shoving the cat away with one arm, holding the precious fish in the other.

Inside the lobby, Yukiko immediately turned to the stairs, instinctively heading for the rooftop food court that had become familiar to her and her friends. Normally she would have taken the elevator, but normally she wasn't being hounded by a swarm of angry cats. Her heart pounding from exhaustion, she continued to urge herself up the stairs two at a time, the constant meowing behind her adding extra incentive. It was a good thing there were only two floors to the store, in addition to the roof.

Finally making it to the door at the top, which thankfully had a latch and was not automatic, Yukiko took a look behind her. The front of the pack was only several steps behind her! Quickly, she shoved the door open, scrambled through, and heaved into it from behind, shutting it just as the cats were about to burst through.

"Ha... ha..." Yukiko could only sigh as she breathed heavily, crumpling to the floor and leaning back against the door. That was too close...

"Yukiko-san? What happened to you? And is that... a fish?"

Yukiko looked up in shock, and saw her friend and classmate Yosuke Hanamura, along with several other people in the food court, all looking at her. Given the state Yukiko was currently in, her pantyhose and sweater reduced to rags, and her remaining clothes also in disarray, she was very embarrassed at being seen like this, even though she would still be considered decently dressed. Or rather she would have been, if what she saw didn't cause her to cringe in fear.

"C-c-cat!" Yukiko stuttered, eyes wide.

"Eh? Oh, this little guy?" Yosuke asked, looking at the little ball of fluff and whiskers in his hands. "We're having a pet day today at Junes, and this guy's owner's letting everyone pet him. You want to give him a hold? You look like you could use a serious stress reliever right about now."

"No!" Yukiko shouted, clutching her fish and turning away.

"Okay, okay, no need to freak out," Yosuke replied, bringing the cat back and handing it off to a nearby woman. "Just have a seat over here..." he pointed to an open table.

Yukiko, deep in her own mind, silently got up and sat down in the chair, setting the fish onto the table. Looking around, she saw some cats and dogs along with their owners milling about around the food court. None of them were charging her. Thank goodness for pet training! Also, the other people who were looking at her when she burst in had went back to their own business as well. Yukiko figured she was safe here for now, but what should she do next? She knew she needed to wait for Chie, but then how would the two of them best avoid the cats on the way back to the Inn?

"So... you look like you've been through hell," Yosuke said casually, yet concerned, taking a seat across from her.

"Yeah," Yukiko glumly replied.

"Want to talk about it?" he asked.

"Not really," Yukiko replied, looking through her bag once more, trying to figure out what to do on her end. Nothing of use except for the fishing rod... but even if she took that out, she would have to cut or fold the fish to stick it in the bag... but she really wanted to keep it intact for cooking. Still, it was starting to look like either battered fish or no fish by this point.

"I thought as much," Yosuke said, looking to the side, sounding a little disappointed. "Oh hey, how about I get you some new wrapping for your fish? It looks like you could use some."

Yukiko looked at the fish again. Indeed, it was only half-covered by newspaper right now. It would need to be fully wrapped if she wanted to sneak by the cats. "Oh, sure," Yukiko replied.

"Okay then," Yosuke said, getting up from his seat. "I'll just run down to our seafood section and get some of that, be back in just a minute."

Yukiko saw him leave, walking to the staircase door. The one she just took. "Wait! Yosuke-!" she warned.

"Huh?" Yosuke's head turned around, but his body continued to open the door.

*Ding*

The food court elevator doors opened revealing a severely scratched up Chie. The sleeves on her tracksuit were completely demolished and her skirt was in tatters, showing off her excercise shorts underneath. Her face lit up as she saw Yukiko ahead of her, but that expression turned to confusion as she saw the girl's worried expression. She followed her gaze and turned to the side...

*MEEEEOOOOWWWW!*

"GAH! What the hell!?" Yosuke screamed as half a dozen cats pounced onto him, some latching in, others bouncing off of him and continuing into the food court.

In an instant, Yukiko was back on her feet, fish in hand, as she sprinted towards the opposite staircase, avoiding the increasingly panicking crowd.

"Yukiko!" Chie shouted, to no avail, as the cats pursued Yukiko and the fish anew. "Rrrgh! Dammit Yosuke!"

"Chie? Me!? How was I supposed to know there'd be a bunch of pissed off cats behind the door!?" Yosuke yelled, struggling in pain.

Leaving her friends and a plaza full of panicked people and pets behind, Yukiko bolted into the other stairwell and shut the door behind her as well. She turned ahead only to see another group of cats!

"What the-!?" she gasped. Did they circle all the way around the store just to catch up to her!?

Taking advantage of her confusion, the cats leapt to attack.

"AAAH! OW! Not again!" Yukiko yelled, clutching the fish protectively in her arms, opting to charge on through. Enduring a flight's worth of scratches and bites as the cats stubbornly held fast, she trudged into the main store the first chance she got. Fortunately, there weren't any customers in sight, not that that helped Yukiko at all at that moment. "Argh, just leave me alone already!" she grunted.

"Yukiko!" rang a shout from behind her.

"Chie!" Yukiko replied, recognizing the voice. "Get these beasts off me!"

"On it, come on Yosuke!"

"Right!" Yosuke replied, his voice alongside Chie's.

Yukiko continued trudging forward, and then felt a tugging sensation all along her back. Undeterred, she continued pushing forward... and was soon released!

*RRRIP*

"Ah!" Chie gasped, holding two cats who were clutching the remains of Yukiko's skirt.

"Uh..." Yosuke uttered, the cat he was holding clutching a large portion of Yukiko's shirt in its claws.

"Oh no..." they both said in unison, seeing a lot more of Yukiko sprinting down the hallways.

Yukiko, however, had ignored the noise completely, taking advantage of her restored movement to put as much distance between herself and the cats as possible. Looking around for an exit, she soon saw a door off to the side. Beelining towards it, she quickly shut herself inside, avoiding the cats once more.

"This is getting completely out of control..." she panted, catching her breath in relative safety.

However, looking around, her relief soon turned to dread. She ended up in a restroom, meaning the only way out was back through the cats! As she checked over herself, she realized it was even worse than that. Her skirt was gone entirely! Only the uppermost parts of her pantyhose that were previously blocked by her skirt remained, covering only her panties. And, checking in the mirror, she saw that her sweater was also gone, and that most of her shirt was torn and open around her midriff, with large holes in the back as well.

As Yukiko was taking this all in, the movement of a stall door opening in the mirror drew her attention. Her face paled. She wasn't alone; someone was going to see her in this mortifying state! However, she didn't know whether to feel even more embarrassed or relieved when the person inside turned out to be another one of her friends. At the very least, she was surprised beyond words to see that the other person was-
1231211.title: Junes.

choices: A group of people appear before the girls, all having a beef with "Teddie".
Teddie's body begins attempting to digest the fish, and Yukiko as well!
12312111.content:
"Yuki-chan!? Half-naked and only wearing rags? I must be in a beautiful dream."

"Oh no..." Yukiko groaned, the color draining from her face upon seeing the colorful costume bear costume that was Teddie. Why, of all people to see her like this, did it have to be that perverted bear? Teddie was a good friend, sure, but he was very unbearable at times, pun fully intended, as he himself would say; especially around the girls of the group. And if the sight of them in swimsuits was enough to excite him into a frenzy...

"Don't worry, Yuki-chan. I don't know what happened, but now that your precious Teddie is here, everything will be a-okay!" he said, arms outstretched running to embrace her in a likely to be less-than-wholesome manner.

"Hey! Back off!" Yukiko said, reacting just in time, smacking Teddie right in the face with her fish.

"BLECK! Ah-Achoo!" Teddie sneezed. "Ah! It got in my nose! Noooo!"

"Sorry, Teddie," Yukiko apologized, bringing the fish to cover her as well as she could. "But you were out of control."

"Achoo! Ugh," Teddie moaned, wiping his nose. "This definitely isn't a dream then. But, but that means..." Teddie's eyes lit up. "Yuki-chan really is almost naked in front of me. What wonderful series of events could have led to this?"

"There's been nothing wonderful about it!" Yukiko growled. "Except for catching this fish, that is. This whole day has been a disaster with those horrible cats aren't letting me get home with my hard-earned catch."

"Cats are trying to steal your fish?" Teddie asked. "Well, I can see why. That fish is eeeenormous! I'm getting hungry just looking at it."

"And in trying to take it from me, they've been picking me apart, reducing me to this!" Yukiko continued, presenting her bare, scratched up arms and legs.

"!!! Those monsters!" Teddie gasped, becoming incensed with rage. "How dare they even lay a single claw on that precious skin of yours!"

"I was lucky though, making it in here. Chie and Yosuke are still dealing with most of them, and Chie's been with me since this all began," Yukiko let out a sigh. "Oh, Chie, you're probably just as messed up as I am right now..."

"Chie-chan too?" Teddie said, his pupils dilated. "All caught up with those awful mangy felines? We need to save her!"

"And Yosuke also," Yukiko said.

"Right, him too," Teddie said dismissively.

Yukiko shook her head, yet smiled all the same. Same old Teddie.

"All right!" Teddie said, waddling to the door. "Stick behind me, Yuki-chan, I'll be your shield!"

"I can't!" Yukiko shouted suddenly, stopping Teddie in his tracks. "I'm still, you know... exposed?"

"Yeah?" Teddie said, obviously thinking nothing was wrong with escorting the young girl half-naked across town back to the inn.

She suppressed the urge to smack him upside the head.

"And those cats still want me and my fish?" she continued. "Do you really want to risk all those beasts clawing me, scratching me all over to take what's rightfully mine?" Yukiko said, doing her best to appeal to Teddie.

"Hm..." Teddie said, pondering. "Now that you mention that, that is a problem... Oh, I know! You can wear me!"

While Yukiko was taken aback by Teddie's blunt solution, he put his arms to his head and lifted it off in one swift motion. As soon as the head disconnected from the neck, the costume collapsed in its shape, draping the smaller dimensions of Teddie's auxiliary human body, a young blonde teenager wearing fancy clothes.

"Oh," Yukiko said in understanding.

"I'll go ahead to help Chie-chan," Teddie said, shrugging off the costume and setting his bear head down on the floor. "A bunch of cats shouldn't be a problem for the great and studly Teddie. RAWR!" he roared, charging out the door.

"Whew, finally," Yukiko sighed, stepping into Teddie's costume. Fortunately, she and Teddie's human form were around the same height, so the costume was able to fit her with little difficulty. The only problem was, once again, how to deal with the fish. Teddie didn't have any pockets large enough to put it into, and she couldn't effectively carry it in her hands...

...There was nothing else for it. Yukiko set the fish down in the costume, next to her leg. It felt weird, but it would be the safest place to store it on her way home.

Or would it? A sudden thought just rang in Yukiko's head. Thinking back to the summer trip, Teddie, in costume form, had once eaten 11 bowls of ramen, including her own when she wasn't looking, but it had all vanished in just a few hours. The costume was Teddie's actual body, after all, and since he was talking about eating the fish earlier... she needed something to keep her fish safe in case he got hungry!

Knowing time was of the essence, Yukiko checked the paper towel dispenser. "Empty!? When are these things ever empty? Rrgh..."

Paper towels weren't an option, and there was no way she was going to use toilet paper to wrap up this precious food. Seeing no other solution, she took off what was left of her shirt and wrapped the fish inside. "There, just good enough," she said, satisfied with her work, setting it in Teddie's costume. As she put it on, she caught glance of her reflection in the mirror, and let out a whine. She was a wreck, what with her hair all messed up, her clothing reduced to just her underwear and bag, and her only other coverage being a lifetime supply of cat scratches along her arms and legs. "Stay strong Yukiko, you can get through this," she said as she put on the head.

Wearing Teddie was very... strange. Though the material didn't feel very thick on the outside, inside it was quite warm, despite her lack of proper clothing. Maybe the costume still indeed functioned as Teddie's main body even when he was outside it. Yukiko quickly banished that thought away before she completely grossed herself out. As for sight, she could actually see pretty well in front of her, despite Teddie's eyes being fairly spaced apart. Another thing to not think too much on, she noted. As for getting around, her movement was hampered a bit, even if the fish wasn't resting alongside her leg. After a few paces to get used to the costume, Yukiko slowly pushed the door open and walked outside.

"Yukiko!" a shout and hug instantly greeted her. "Just where he said you'd be!"

"Chie!?" Yukiko gasped in response, nearly thrown off-balance by Chie's tackle. Chie was a bit worse for wear, her tracksuit looking more like a vest, now torn along the front and hanging open, and her shirt underneath had taken some damage as well, but her shorts and everything else was just as fine as before; far better than Yukiko's current situation, the more-naked girl noted with some jealousy. "Where's Yosuke and Teddie? And the cats?"

"Oh man, it was brutal," said Chie.

"Oh no!" said Yukiko.

"Oh? No, not the fight," Chie backpedaled. "We took care of the cats easily enough, even if we got messed up a bit during the fight, but right as we got done chasing them out the stairs, Teddie comes charging in."

"Mmhm, that sounds about right."

"Yeah, well, he thought he was going to be a hero and save us with his big entrance. But not only was he too late, Yosuke then tore into him for slacking off for the past 3 hours, forcing him to do all the work and being forced to deal with this catastrophe by himself."

"Catastrophe?" Yukiko repeated Chie's unintentional pun, barely suppressing her laughter.

"Yeah, so now he and Teddie are off doing damage control upstairs. I do not envy either of them right now, especially Teddie."

"Oh... we really shouldn't have come here," Yukiko winced in sympathy.

"Well, shit happens," Chie shrugged. "I'm just glad Teddie gave you something so that you wouldn't be walking home in your underwear. He better not have perved on you too hard in there, or else-!."

"Yeah-what?" Yukiko gasped. "You know?"

"Those cats were fierce," Chie said, looking awkwardly aside. "It happened right as we helped you get onto this floor."

"So Yosuke also..." Yukiko said. Chie couldn't see it, but Yukiko's face was as red as her flame skills. "You're right," Yukiko said sternly. "Those two should be just fine. Let's go."

With that, Yukiko and Chie made their way out the other side of Junes and back onto the streets. It was now fully nightime, the only lights coming from streetlamps, the moon, and the stars. They were nervous walking the darkened pathways, dreading the possibility of another attack, but not a single sight nor sound of cat was to be found.

"Whooo..." Chie sighed. "The inn's only a couple streets away. Looks like we're finally in the clear."

"Yes," Yukiko agreed. There was still cooking the fish and seeing how it would work, but that would be a trial for another day. This ordeal was nearly finished. She was especially grateful for this stroke of good luck. She felt like thanking Teddie for this later, especially in lending her himself. Unfortunately, any notions of thanking Teddie for the use of his body were about to go up in smoke, as it was about to cause a problem of its own, despite them being so close to safety. As they turned the next street corner-

Refuse to offer it to her.
1231212.content:
Yukiko ran up the steps of the small shrine next to the old town shopping district. The last golden blot of sunlight was fading over the horizon, and the shadows of twilight clustered tightly around the stone statutes and wooden structures. The place felt silence and empty, and the stillness made Yukiko's footsteps on the hard stone pathway seems especially loud in contrast. The shrine had long since been abandoned by any formal caretaker, and it showed in the faded paint and crumbling facades of the building and surrounding hillside.

Yukiko took in a breath as she moved deeper into the shrine. During the day she loved to come here to be by herself or pray to the local kami. She also visited the shrine at night, but for entirely different reasons. Most people, including Yu Narukami, had to work up their courage to come to the place in the dark. It looked far too much like the setting for any number of horror stories, and local superstition warned that kami or other shinto spirits liked to abduct anyone who trespassed in a sacred space such as this. But Yukiko had become rather fearless of such things. choices: Take off just the apron and leave the rest of the uniform unchanged.
Take off the apron and change into shorts and a tank top.
Take off her shirt and skirt and wear only the apron and her underwear/swimsuit.
1323.content:
However, there were times when the opposite was true as well. Though the common, down-to-earth appearance of her in the tofu shop was presenting herself naturally, away from all the glamour and false appearances in show business, this wasn't her true self either. It was something she had been coming to terms with recently, ever since she was rescued from the world inside the TV. Risette, the cheery, sexy celebrity, and Rise, ordinary high-school girl and tofu shop worker were both parts of her, so why did she have to feel like she was smothering a part of herself when committing to either image?

Rise sighed as she looked through the shop door out onto the empty street. She liked her downtime well enough, but she was starting to get bored. And all this introspection was making her uncomfortable.

"Rise?" a voice from behind asked.

"Grandma?" Rise turned around. "What is it? Is something wrong in the back?"

"No, no," Rise's grandmother replied. "We're just running low on ingredients, so I was going to go buy some more. Will you be okay with looking after the shop while I'm gone?"

"Oh, of course," Rise replied.

"Thank you. I'll be back as soon as I can, though from how things have been, I'd be surprised if we had even a single customer today."

"Cheer up, grandma. Maybe business will pick up while you're gone. See you soon."

And with that, Rise's grandmother left the shop, leaving Rise alone with her thoughts again. Soon enough, it was back to her earlier train of thought. Rise... Risette... they were both her, so they shouldn't really be that different, right? If only she could combine these two facets of herself, maybe then this wouldn't be so confusing.

Rise's eyes shot open, considering that last bit. Maybe there was a way to combine the two...

With her grandmother out and no customers around, the perfect opportunity presented itself. Rushing through the back of the shop to her own room, a plan took shape in her mind; a plan to present a Rise that encompassed all her selves.

Inside her room, Rise looked at herself in the mirror. This was the first, and arguably most important step: putting together an outfit that would combine the vivacious Risette and plain ol' Rise. If done right, then the rest would start to fall into place. Looking at her options, Rise decided to-
1323.title: She got bored with her plain clothes.

choices: One of the Investigation Team bursts in. Emergency meeting at Junes!
Business suddenly picks up, quickly overwhelming Rise.
Rise's new attire encounters problems with store equipment.
13233.content:
Rise smiled mischievously as she quickly tossed off her apron and went about removing her shirt and skirt. Practiced at quickly changing from her idol work, Rise was standing in front of her mirror in just her underwear in no time. The starlet couldn't deny that she cut an impressive figure standing there in her lacy orange undergarments. That definitely fulfilled the Risette aspect of her look.

Picking the apron back up, Rise quickly tied it around herself once more. Appraising herself in the mirror, Rise was satisfied with what she saw. From the front, everything seemed innocent enough. At most, someone would assume she was wearing shorts and a tank top, but a view of her sides or from behind would disprove that theory in an instant. It was naughty, it was risque, and Rise was loving it!

"And just like that, Rise and Risette are fused into one!" Rise said to herself happily as she skipped out of her room and back to the store front.

A thrill went up Rise's spine as she took her place at the register. The shop was still dead, with no signs of changing, but that didn't lessen the excitement from this little stunt of hers. Here she was, plain old Rise in the front, and scandalous starlet Risette everywhere else! This test of blending her styles was quickly proving itself to be a rousing success!

At least it was, until things changed...
13233.title: Take off her shirt and skirt and wear only the ...

choices: The Bathhouse dungeon.
The Striptease dungeon.
132331.content:
"Hey, Rise! There you are!" yelled the blonde, burly teen that just barged into the shop.

"K-Kanji!" Rise gasped, thrown completely off-guard. She was hoping to try out her experiment on a completely random stranger, not one of her friends! "What are you doing here?"

"What am I doing here?" Kanji asked. "What are you doing here? Didn't you get the message?"

"Message?" Rise asked, realizing that she hadn't checked her phone recently and was away from it while changing her clothes. Sure enough, there was an unread text message from Yu, their leader of sorts.

Everyone,

Emergency meeting at Junes. Please get here ASAP.

"Oh my gosh!" said Rise.

"Yeah, glad I decided to check if you were still at work. Everyone's probably there by now, so let's go."

"Kanji, I can't just leave," Rise said, surreptitiously backing up towards the door. "Grandma's out, so I have to at least lock up first," That, and I'm wearing next to nothing under this apron!

"Oh, that won't be a problem, dear."

Rise's eyes went wide. It was her grandmother, back from her errands. "Grandma? You're back already?"

"I should be able to the rest from here. You go have fun with your friends," she said, as she moved back into the backroom.

"All right!" Kanji cheered.

"Kanji, I need to-"

"Come on, we're already late," he yelled, running towards Rise and grabbing her hand.

"Kanji, wha- HEY!" Rise cried out as Kanji started pulling her out the shop.

"Sorry, but it's time to haul ass!"

Rise struggled to stay in place, but the momentum was too much, and she was soon outside the shop and down the street. There weren't any people around at the moment, but Rise felt exposed all the same. "Kanji!" Rise yelled, forcing her hand out of his grasp.

"What?" he asked.

Rise was fuming. If only Kanji had just given her a minute to get decent, but now it was too late. She kept her shoes on so she could move around fine, but as for everything else... They had already made it to the end of the shopping district and were just a stones throw away from Junes. Since this apparently was an emergency, there wouldn't be enough time to go back and change.

On the other hand, she had wanted to test this out for real, and she was still just as covered in the back as she would be on the beach. Still, running around town like this was a bit much.

Ah well, whatever happened from now on, she decided to hold Kanji directly responsible.

"You don't just grab a girl's hand and force her along like that!" she scolded.

"I-I know that, dammit!" Kanji said sheepishly, turning out of shame. "But-"

"I still needed to return my work apron you dummy!" she said. "You don't see Yosuke running around the TV in his, or Yukiko in her kimono, do you?"

"Oh... sorry. Should we go back?"

"Nope, too late now. We're already late aren't we, now let's go!" Rise said, signaling Kanji forward.

"Y-yeah," Kanji replied, confused, but running ahead once again.

They soon found themselves at Junes, where there actually were people milling about in the lobby, doing their own thing. Rise stayed calm, keeping her back away from them as Kanji called the elevator. The doors opened, and the pair entered, with Rise taking a deep breath first.

"All right, up to the roof. Huh, what's their rush?" Kanji spoke, as several people sprinted into the elevator after them.

Rise knew though, confirmed when the people continued to look at her and not turn towards the front as one always would in the elevator. They saw her scantily-clad backside as she entered, and were wanting to see more. She began to grow nervous. Surrounded by these kind of guys in an elevator with no way out was not a good situation to be in.

"Hey, what's your deal, huh?" Kanji spoke, eyeing one of the strangers threateningly.

"H-huh?" the man sputtered.

"Got a problem with us?" he growled.

"No, no problem at all!" the man stuttered, him and the other strangers immediately turning toward the front.

Rise silently exhaled in relief.

The elevator soon reached the rooftop, and the strangers, still intimidated by Kanji, quickly left the elevator first. Kanji and Rise then headed out, heading to their usual table where the rest of the Investigation Team was already waiting. "Sorry to keep you guys waiting," Rise said, taking her usual seat on the bench while keeping her back away from the team members.

"Yeah, sorry for the holdup," said Kanji.

"No worries, we just got here too," said Chie.

"Rise, did we get you during a bad time? You're still wearing your apron," Yukiko asked.

"You can thank Kanji for that," Rise snarked.

"Hey, I said I was sorry," said Kanji.

"Everyone," Yu spoke up, stopping their talk. "Thank you for making it here on such short notice."

"No problem, so what's the big emergency?" Yosuke asked.

"It is very important," said Yu. "I've been checking our equipment, and it's out of date. It's been forever since we did this last, so it's time to get lots of materials from the TV World so that Daidara can make some new gear for us. The shadows are growing tougher, so we need to be ready."

Mutters of assent went around the table. Rise was annoyed, though. How was a farming run a big emergency? Such a big deal out of nothing, though perhaps she just felt that way because she was merely support and as such never got any new equipment to wear, so runs like these were not nearly as exciting as diving in to save someone, explore new territory, or to specifically hunt a tough shadow.

But, the silver lining at least was that she would be away from prying eyes in the TV world. Prying eyes that she noticed were all around her. None of the watchers were close to the table, thanks to the team being in a large group, but she could feel them nonetheless. She wondered what they were thinking right now. Considering how those elevator goons acted, she was starting to get second thoughts.

"Okay, let's go," Yu said, and everyone got up from their seats. Rise did likewise, following up the rear.

Fortunately, none of the people upstairs followed them into the electronics department, and no regular customers were around, so entering the TV unseen was no problem. Rise landed last within the middle of the circle, quickly picking herself up and backing herself up near the exit. It probably wouldn't matter much if her friends saw like this, really. After all, her shadow was wearing a bikini when they rescued her, so it's not like they would be seeing anything people hadn't already seen. But then there would be questions of why, and she wasn't comfortable with or sure enough explaining to them yet. Well, Yu-senpai maybe, he seemed to understand her the best, but there was still a ways to go before that! Anyways, it was fine. She'd deal with it if it happened, but hardly anyone was ever behind her, so it's likely they won't ever know. Right?

She kept these thoughts in mind as Yu brought up their plan for the gathering run, and they began today's mission. Their first destination was-
132331.title: One of the Investigation Team bursts in. Emerge...

choices: At her, and her steam-soaked apron.
At the entrance, where a swarm of Shadows had appeared.
1323311.content:
Within short order, the team found themselves in front of the bathouse dungeon, where Kanji's Shadow once ruled. Its former master was long since gone, but the air was just as thick with hot, moist steam as it was before, slowly flowing out the entrance. No doubt the inside was just as thick with Shadows, but they were confident that they wouldn't be a problem even with their outdated equipment, as a quick scan from Rise confirmed. The team split up, with Yu, Yosuke, Chie, and Naoto heading inside, while Yukiko, Kanji, and Teddie waited outside as backup with Rise.

Rise summoned her persona and began relaying information to the team as she always did. However, with such weak enemies being fought, she began to grow lax, her mind subconsciously beginning to wonder. Not helping was that none of her friends outside were being particularly talkative either, especially Kanji, who always seemed nervous around this place. It made sense though, as she, Yukiko, and Naoto also had similar reservations with their Shadow's dungeons. But even though she could sympathize, She couldn't help but wonder just what had happened here. If it was anything like her own experience...

But before Rise could continue her speculation, she noticed something odd. Yu and the others' presences in the dungeon were diminishing. That never happened before! Pushing further with her persona, she felt something clouding up her vision. Flinching, she pulled back and performed a wider area scan.

Her face grimaced as she saw the results. All vision from the 4th floor onwards, where the party had just entered, had become blurry! She could still feel her friends, but their signatures were getting fainter with every second.

"Rise-chan!" Yukiko's voice shouted, shattering her concentration.

"W-What?" Rise gasped, as her vision returned to that of the dungeon's entrance area. Her allies soon came back into focus, allowing her to notice that they were all staring-
1323311.title: The Bathhouse dungeon.

choices: Her friends are still there, arguing away.
Her friends are gone!
13233111.content:
With everyone's eyes looking at her with confused looks on their faces, Rise had a fair idea of what happened. With a slight gulp, she stared down and saw that her apron had indeed become soaked through by the steam. While the apron may have been thick enough to still hide her skin even in this wet state, the bright orange color of her underwear shone through like a neon-lit sign. Now they all knew, which made her feel so...

Wait, how did she feel exactly? Sure she was embarrassed now that they could see her underwear and knew she was only wearing that underneath the apron, but not that much, now that she thought about it. She, or rather, her shadow, was wearing just as much when they rescued her, and these were her friends for goodness sake. And they were all just a few steps away from noticing up until now, it was strange that they hadn't noticed yet, especially Kanji. Really, she was starting to feel more frustrated at herself for freezing up just now.

The point was, they now knew, and it wouldn't do any good to try and hide it. Besides, the whole point of wearing her clothes like that in the shop was to have someone see her like this, so that she would know for sure. Without an audience to actually test out that look, the entire day would have been nothing more than pointless dress-up! So, why not have her friends be that audience? Much better than random elevator creeps any day... and she was not going to let that be her only memory of this.

"Well, looks like the jig is up," Rise said casually, flashing a cheeky grin.

"Somebody pinch me, because I must be dreaming!" Teddie cried out, being the first to react. "Why else would Rise-chan be dressed so sexily just for me?"

"It's not for you, Teddie!" Rise yelled. Of course he would jump straight to the most perverted reason. "I was just feeling, er, doing something new to try and help draw in customers for the tofu shop. See?" she said, turning and showing her underwear-clad backside to them, to much reaction. She was pleased to feel some relief at letting them know, and couldn't help but giggle at their surprised gasps, but she still felt too nervous to give the true reason behind her attire, thanks to Teddie just now.

"Oh so this was for business?" said Yukiko. "And here I was thinking you ran out of clean laundry except for your underwear today."

"What?" Rise, asked, followed by a weird look from her, Kanji, and Teddie.

"Oh shit!" said Kanji, smacking his forehead. "So that's what you meant when you said you needed to return your uniform! And I just dragged you to Junes flashing your panties everywhere?"

"It's not underwear, it's a swimsuit!" Rise shouted. "Geez... well, it's fine though, it's nothing anyone wouldn't have seen if they went to the shop today," Rise shrugged.

"Really? They make swimsuits with that much lace?" Yukiko asked.

"Swimsuit, underwear, what's the difference?" Kanji asked. "Aren't you covered up about the same either way?"

"Tut, tut, tut," Teddie admonished, waggling his glove. "Oh, Kanji, you really don't know anything do you? Of course they're different. Different as night and day."

"Oh really?" Kanji said sarcastically. "How?"

"It's simple really. Swimsuits you can wear in public, but underwear you can't!" Teddie beamed. The weird looks now shifted towards him. "What? C'mon you know I'm right!"

"It's not that simple Teddie," Yukiko said. "The difference is that swimsuits are made to handle water, but underwear is not," the looks shifted towards her once again. "What? I wouldn't go swimming in my underwear."

"That's just as lame as Teddie's explanation!" Kanji said, before launching into an argument with the others.

Rise sighed. It was a bit of a letdown that their attention had passed so quickly, but also a relief to see her friends arguing about nothing. Basically they were acting just as they had before they found out about her. I guess once the shock has passed, there really isn't much of a difference whether I'm fully dressed, in my underwear or somewhere in between. I'm still me, after all.

Rise blinked, and chuckled in realization. There was no need to try and combine Rise and Risette in her attire, they were combined in her and how she acted! If anything, all she could learn from this was that work was really, really boring, and that she had a mischievous, naughty streak, both of which were things she already knew about herself. Also, she felt hot, sweaty, and suddenly remembered that she was still in front of a steamy bathouse dungeon in a saturated apron, and that going back home like that was probably a bad idea.

"Well, better dry this off," she said, walking back towards the entrance while the others continued their argument. Once there, she removed the apron and cap and hung them off the edge of one of the exit TVs, then ran back towards the bathouse.

Once she got there, she found that-
13233111.title: At her, and her steam-soaked apron.

choices: The Entertainers door
The Audience door
132331111.content:
"I'm telling you, they are distinctly different!" Teddie yelled. "Even Yuki-chan knows that!"

"But they're the same shape and everything!" Kanji shouted back. "I mean, why else would Naoto be too afraid to wear a swimsuit during the pageant?"

"It's not that easy with Naoto-kun, you know..." said Yukiko.

"Hehe, oh Kanji..." Rise said to herself. "Whenever Naoto is mentioned you just- wait, Naoto? Oh crap!" she yelled, realizing that she had forgotten something very important.

"Rise? Wah!" Kanji gasped, the others appropriately reacting in tandem as the idol was now standing before them in just her bright orange bra and panties.

"It still looks like underwear to me..." said Yukiko.

"No more apron? This really must be my birthday!" Teddie swooned.

"It's a swimsuit, and the apron's drying, but neither one's important right now!" Rise said, some slight red in her cheeks from Teddie's remarks. "Earlier I sensed something clouding up my readings and was losing track of everyone, but then I got side-tracked with this! I just hope I'm not too late," she said, scanning with Himiko once more.

The others clammed up instantly, desperately waiting for the results of Rise's scan. "Senpai? Anyone? Can you hear me?" Rise asked as she searched and searched, but no response came. Soon her persona faded away. "Well?" Yukiko asked, breaking the silence that had settled over the group.

"It's no good," Rise shook her head. "There's no sign of them and I couldn't get ahold of them either. And just like before, I couldn't penetrate any deeper than the fourth floor from here."

"No way!" Teddie gasped.

"It feels like there's something... clouding up the area, like this steam. I can't find them at all like this."

"Then what are we waiting for?" said Kanji, turning towards the bathouse's front door. "We gotta go in there and find them!"

"Right," Rise nodded. "Let's go, everyone."

And with that, the four of them ran into the dungeon.

The dungeon didn't seem very different from the last time they were there, according to everyone but Rise, at least. The monsters were no different and proved virtually no challenge, the layout had changed but not by very much, really the only difference was that the bathouse steam was far thicker than before. As they continued, Rise tried to scan for the rest of the party again, but found that she could not see further than the fourth floor, despite being closer. A bad feeling arose through the group.

Soon enough, the team reached the fourth floor of the dungeon, where they were met with a strange sight. Unlike the other areas of the dungeon, this hallway was mostly steam-free, leading them to realize just how much the steam was soaking them through earlier. Rise, quickly shuddering, glanced at herself, and sighed in relief. Fortunately her underwear was still opaque. Thank goodness she wasn't wearing white today. Going through the hallway, they found that it was a very short corridor with the only exit being two separate doors on the far end.

"What the-?" Kanji gasped.

"What is this?" Yukiko asked.

"*sniff* I can smell in here!" said Teddie. "No sign of the others though..."

"So wait, this... wasn't part of the dungeon before?" Rise asked.

"Nuh-uh," Teddie replied. "There was never an area so clear of both steam and the ugly stench of sweat."

"Hey!" Yukiko, who had advanced to the end of the hallway, called. "Take a look at this!"

The team followed and saw what she found: two doors at the end of the hallway. Each door was completely normal and unremarkable, only sporting a sign on the front of each one. Upon a closer look, the sign on the left door said "Entertainers," while the one on the right said "Audience."

"Entertainers? Audience? Is there some kind of show going on in here?" Kanji asked.

"There definitely wasn't anything like this before," Yukiko said. "Could someone have been thrown in?"

"Nope, can't be," said Teddie. "I would've smelled something. Maybe the shadows here changed on their own?"

"But this was my dungeon, wasn't it?" Kanji asked. "And I know I haven't done anything with it. Argh! Whatever, we can't just sit here while Senpai needs us! Let's just pick one and go through!" he said, reaching out.

"Wait!" Rise shouted, stopping him in his tracks. "Before we do, let me check one more time!" she said as she scanned once more.

The steam was as thick as before and she couldn't get a layout of the location, but this time, she could feel some familiar presences, somewhere behind the door. "It's Senpai and the others! They're just about in front of us, but I can't tell anything else!" Rise shouted.

"Alright, then what are we waiting for, let's go!" said Kanji.

"Hold on! What if it's a trap?" Yukiko said.

"Wha-?" said Kanji.

"Rise can't sense anything else right? So who knows what's back there? We're still going, but we need to be careful!" Yukiko explained.

"Oh, right." said Kanji. "You know, this Entertainer and Audience sounds like showbiz stuff... what do you think, Rise?"

"Hm..." said Rise, thinking it over. It did sound like show business, almost too much like that in fact. "If this is a show, then the door on the left means we'll be going on a stage, while the door on the right goes to the seats, I think? They should both lead to the same area, but it can't be that simple. Maybe we'll be forced to 'perform' or 'watch', depending on the door we choose, which could mean anywhere from a battle or a puzzle as far as Shadows are concerned. Oh, let me check..." she tried both door handles. "Yep, they're both unlocked, so whatever's made this is forcing us to make one choice or the other. But which one..." she pondered.

"I know nothing about show business," said Teddie. "Ooo! Maybe we should take the audience door and see what happens. I love watching things!"

"I dunno, Ted," said Kanji. "I don't like these creeps telling us what to do. Besides, it could just be us sitting there while the Shadows do whatever the hell they want. The other way around, at least we're doing something, so I think we should go through that one, especially if it's just some kind of fight."

"That's a good point, Kanji, but I can't help but wonder... What kind of show is this anyways?" Yukiko asked. "Sure, if we go onstage we may only have to fight, but it may instead be a performance, which could mean anything. It could be fun to act out a play, but if it's anything like the midnight channel... I really don't want to do anything embarrassing like that, you know?" she drew off.

"Oh... Hadn't thought of that," said Kanji.

The group grew silent once more.

"You know," Yukiko picked up again. "I think we should leave it up to Rise."

"Oh?" Rise asked, surprised.

"You do this sort of thing all the time right?" Yukiko asked. "So I think you have the best chance of getting us through this."

"That's a wonderful idea!" Teddie cheered. "Rise's got more experience at this than any of us, so I believe in her!"

"Yeah, that makes sense," said Kanji. "Alright, I'll follow your lead, Rise. Just tell us where to go!"

"Really? Wow! Um..." Rise was astonished. Normally all the decisions were left up to her senpai, and she just went along with them and provided what support she could, but now they were looking to her for this important choice. Suddenly she felt a lot of pressure, but also some pride in how they were all looking up to her. She almost felt she was dreaming for a second, (she was running around in her underwear after all,)but it was a very real and very serious situation right now.

So, Rise weighed the options one more time, and made her decision. "Okay, guys," she said. "We are going to go through-"
