...the shadows dragged her away.
13233112.content:
Rise gasped in shock as a parade of freaks floated and squirmed their way out of the misty gloom of the TV world. The former pop idol instinctively took several steps back, exposing her underwear to her friends. Fortunately, the group seemed too focused on the shadows to notice her near nudity, her three companions advancing forward to form a protective wall between her and the denizens of the other world.

"Hey Rise!" Kanji barked as he brandished a folding chair at the horrors. "Let's hear some intel on these things! How do we hit em where it really hurts, huh?"

"J-just a sec!" Rise said, her voice quivering. How could that horde have just snuck up on them like that? Even with her attention focused on the group inside Himiko was usually aware enough to warn her about any incoming threats, especially such a large number of them! Could that "blur out" she was experiencing on the 4th floor be the cause? Was something interfering with her awareness?

"Himiko! Scan the targets!" Rise said, taking in a deep breath and focusing on the battle in front of her. "....Persona!....Himiko?"

Nothing. Her Persona, who had been dutifully keeping track of affairs inside the bathhouse mere moments ago, would not so much as appear in front of her. Rise had a vague feeling of her presence, the way she always did in the real world despite being unable to summon her directly...but even that felt off. Something was interfering with her connection!

"Guys, we have a problem!" Rise called, when suddenly she found herself enfolded in slimy tendrils. A group of shadows had snuck around her friends and ambushed her, and her sudden lack of a Persona was as good as being blind in this place! Rise gasped in alarm as...
13233112.title: At the entrance, where a swarm of Shadows had a...

choices: To the TV exit, where she is stripped and tossed into the real world
To the striptease dungeon for an unexpected reunion.
132331122.content: But where could they be taking her?
132331122.title: ...the shadows dragged her away.

choices: Rise is suppressing other thoughts as well
Rise needs to stay naked for a time.
1323311222.content:
Rise slowly came awake. Her head was pounding like a hangover and she felt strangely drained. For a moment all she knew was confusion and a hazy sense of unease. As her memories came back to her she sat upright in alarm. The shadows had been dragging her away, and then...she must have passed out. She was lucky to be alive. But where had...

"Oh no..." Rise said, her unease increasing tenfold. That strange purplish haze in the air, that gaudy combination of purple and lavender, the projected lights of kissing lips and naked silhouettes, the thundering bump and grind music in the background...and that horrible smell of perform that couldn't quite overpower the distinctive odor of sweat and sex. Oh yes, Rise Kujikawa knew this place all too well. This was her world, the realm spawned by her heart when she was first tossed into the TV world. The fact that it resembled a strip bar was just one of many reasons why she hated to come here.

"Why? Of all the places they had to take me, why HERE? Do those pervy little monsters want me to put on a show or something?" Rise muttered to herself.

"Oh come on. No need to be so melodramatic." A voice came from somewhere in the smoke filled darkness. "They were just being good little boys and doing what mommy asked for."

Rise rose to her feet, despite a tremor that was running up her spine. Like this place, that voice sounded horribly familiar. It had a tone and resonance almost like her own, and yet there was something alien and distorted about it. Rissette knew well before the figure emerged from the smoke what she would see...a near perfect clone of herself, dressed in a tiny golden bikini, a fashion that complimented the demented yellow gleam of her eyes. Rise's shadow, the inner manifestation of her hidden thoughts and desires. But knowing what to expect made seeing it no less terrible. Rise stood in stunned silence as her nearly naked counterpart sauntered up to her and plucked the glasses from her face.

"I love the new look." Her doppleganger said with a smile, putting the glasses on and giving a little twirl. "We're like a sexy librarian now!"

"H-how...Why...WHY ARE YOU BACK?" Rise screamed.

"Where else would I be? After all...you're here now...and I am you."

"That's a lie! You can't-wha!" Rise stopped abruptly as she found two fingers pressed against her lips.

"Look, me. We've been through this part. And it was a lot of fun, being denied and going berserk and nearly killing all your friends before getting messed up by a giant teddie bear. But it was pretty much a once in a lifetime kind of performance. So let's make a deal. I won't try to provoke you, and you don't say something stupid you'll instantly regret. Okayyyy?"

Rise stared at her double. The shadow was right, of course. By deny the connection between them, Rise would have inspired a hideous transformation in her Shadow. But why had the SHADOW been the one to stop her?

"R-right. What I meant was...aren't you Himiko? Why...are you back to being...this?" Rise said at last.

The shadow shrugged. "Same reason as before, me. You've been having some slippery little thoughts running through your head recently that you don't want to admit to yourself, and thanks to the way this world works its now my job to spell it out for you."

"But...I thought we settled this already! Rise and Rissette are the same person! I was looking for the 'real me' everywhere when the reality was that I was always me! Rise is Rise...your me and I'm you. That's...all we need to do, right? I just need to accept that you're a part of me! I do! Please be my Persona again!" Rise said in desperation.

The shadow smiled in what Rise almost thought was honest affection. But then her face turned impish once again. "So I'm the real you? Are you sure? What about them?"

A series of spotlights clicked on around them, and in each stood another clone of Rissette dressed in different costumes from various commercials and concerts and the occasional movie cameo from her career. Each of them cooed and waved at the pair in the center.

"Sigh. Those are ALL me, okay?" Rise said in exasperation. "Or maybe none of them are. There is no such thing as the 'real me'. Every part I've played, every song I've sung...I put something of myself into all of it. I was wrong for feeling that I was being fake or losing myself before. We've been over all of this! None of the props or the roles matter. Take them away and its always just been me."

"You heeeeeaaaaaaard her!" The shadow said with excitement.

A dumbstruck Rise watched as her laughing clones happily stripped off their costumes and slowly approached the two girls in the center. Soon Rise found herself surrounded by dozens of naked versions of herself, posing in various embarrassing ways that emphasized her private places in extravagant ways. Despite herself, Rise was blushing like a tomato.

"Aww...she's embarrassed. Don't be embarrassed." The shadow said, hugging her counterpart. "It means a lot that you want to accept me all over again. It seriously does. Believe it or not, that's what I want too. The first time we met I was furious at being ignored for so many years. But then you accepted me, and you've been acknowledging me ever since. It felt really good nice helping to track down killers and save the other dopes that fell into the TV. So I'm gonna be a little more patient with you this time. We'll get through this together, and I'll help every step of the way. But this time things are a little trickier..."

"W-why..." Rise asked as she gaped at the naked antics of her other selves.

"Hmmmm....I wonder...." The Shadow said with a smirk as it disengaged from her.

Rise stared at her in confusion. Her other selves tittered. Her primary shadow smiled, and made a show of walking around her. As she began to pass behind Rise's apron, the girl self consciously moved with her shadow to hide her exposed backside. The shadow smiled and continued to try and look behind the illusion of modest Rise had created for herself, forcing Rise to move around in a little circle. The titter from the other girls grew louder, and Rise suddenly realized she had been tricked into mooning all of her assembled spectators by twirling around as she had. She blushed furiously, and that moment was all her shadow needed to skip behind her and grab a handful of orange panty and yank sharply upward.

"EEEEK!" Rise cried as she was given a sudden wedgie.

"Rise, Rise, Rise...." Her shadow said softly, swatting her exposed cheeks as she pulled on her underwear. "Exposing yourself in public? Minding a store with your half naked body barely hidden by an apron? Giving all the customers at Junes such a great look at our firm little butt? How embarrassing! How mortifying! Who need the famous Rissette was really just a slut that loves to expose her body to an audience??"

"That's...that's not-OWWW!" Rise screamed as she received another spanking.

"Look around, me. The stripper poles, the setting, all of those threats I made to take it off last time we were here. Did you think that was a joke?" The shadow whispered as she dropped poor befuddled Rise to the floor.

"I wanted to be done with showbiz! I thought Rissette was fake! I wanted to be seen for who I really was, not what was pretending to be! You were just exaggerating all of that! B-being naked was just a metaphor!" Rise said.

"And if I said it wasn't?" The shadow asked gently as it knelt next to her.

"I'm not a pervert!" Rise wailed.

"Oooooh? Sooo....you've never stood out on a stage, feeling that little bite of dread and excitement as all those faces turn towards you, staring and clapping, all there to see you. You've never wondered just how much MORE intense the terror and the excitement would be without your clothes? You've never come home after a long day of exercise and eaten a pitiful little salad because of your diet, and then looked in the mirror at the gorgeous creature you've worked so hard to become..." The shadow ran a hand down Rise's exposed stomach and hip. "...and let out a little sigh thinking its such a waste your fans can't see more of it?"

"Sh-shut up." Rise said softly.

"It happens all the time. Some believed childhood icon ruins their image by doing little nude scene in a movie or maybe making a questionable music video. People get scandalized, the news calls it a tragedy. But that's what their business forces on them. They spend so many years being molded into this picture of sweatness and innocence, and have to spend so many more years breaking out of that image to reclaim some semblance of a career. Happens all the time. But I'm not sure anyone has dreaded and yearned for that moment as much as little Rise Kujikawa!"

"S-STOP IT!" Rise snapped.

The Shadow smiled and fell silent.

"I...get it! I get a thrill out of dressing like this! And I'm ashamed of doing it too. So...you came back because of that conflict, right? F-Fine! I'll..I accept that. I hate hearing it, but I'll accept it as the truth! Can we please just END this now?"

The Shadow sighed. "Wish it was that simple."

13233112221.content:
"Wh-what do you mean?!" Rise asked. "Of course it's that simple! I accept the unpleasant truth and you -all of you- calm down and things go back to normal!"

"Poor, naive little Rise." the Shadow taunted. "Just saying the words isn't the trick, especially not with issues of this nature. To really accept us, to make all of us return quietly, you need to become comfortable with the fact that we exist. Thing is, well... your thoughts are just so contradictory! For example..."

Several more figures seemed to fade into being, and the naked and posing Rise shadows were joined by (thankfully clothed) Rises, each sporting a more outrageous outfit than the last. These outfits weren't anything Rise had worn for any photo shoot or television spot. There was a maid, an outfit that likely was supposed to be a police officer, a set of tight leather gear that left nothing to the imagination, and others still.

"You get a thrill out of dressing like this, sure, but you're even more excited by the idea of being seen, aren't you?" the Shadow asked, her mouth all but touching Rise's ear, hot breath tickling her skin.

"I-I... I don't... I mean..." Rise stammered, unsure of what to say. "How could I be excited if it makes me so embarrassed?"

"That's the question, isn't it? The contradiction, the way it makes your heart race, but also makes your knees shake in fear. How are any of us supposed to feel at home inside you when you can't figure out what you feel?" the Shadow pressed. "Though I see now that perhaps I was doing more than I thought with those spanks. At least, if those two are any indication."

Rise gasped as she saw what her Shadow meant. The leather-clad Rise had bent the maid over, delivering sharp swats to her bouncy backside with a riding crop, each crack of the crop eliciting a cry from the maid that sounded far more like pleasure than pain. Rise couldn't even begin to understand how this made sense. She'd never even thought about such a thing, even when she was sneaking a rare moment of pleasure to herself. Was this... was this really how she felt?

"So... how am I supposed to accept these thoughts?" Rise pleaded. "I need Himiko back, and all of you under control!"

"Oh, it's easy!" the main Shadow chirped. "You just let us handle that. You see, with so many of us restless, you aren't exactly running a strong defense inside yourself. When we can, we'll just... take the wheel from you. You'll still be conscious and aware of your surroundings, so don't worry about waking up with no idea what's going on. You just won't have any say over what we decide you'll be doing."

"Wh-what do you mean?!" Rise demanded, but as soon as the question left her mouth, the room was empty. Just as swiftly appeared, all the Rises were gone...

"That must have just been a weird trick. Something the Shadows cooked up to mess with my head. No way any of that was real." Rise told herself. She could feel Himiko's presence again, after all. Unless her Persona could also manifest its Shadow form, that alone seemed proof enough of a wild hallucination. That wasn't important at the moment, though. She had to get back to the others!

Rise quickly dashed out of the room, using Himiko to maneuver through the dungeon and avoid any shadows along the way. The odd encounter with her Shadow was already being pushed to the back of her mind to be forgotten. Unfortunately for Rise, what she'd just went through was no hallucination, and her repressed feelings and thoughts were simply waiting for the right time to assert their control...

Or was it? she wondered, looking down at her front. The apron was as smooth and solid as ever, and the amount of coverage was just the same as before. The only difference anyone would see now was that there was no longer the bright orange strap of her bra across the middle of her now bare back. And with the shoulder straps were no longer getting in the way of her shoulders, her arms were free to move comfortably. What was a few extra inches of skin between her shoulder blades anyways?

Rise woke up that morning with a loud yawn and a little stretch. Rising out of bed in her silky nightie Rise glanced at her calendar and began to smile one of her exuberant smiles. Nothing was happening today. She wasn't needed at the shop, there wasn't any school, and happily the investigation team had no leads to follow or victims in need of rescue. Today was one of those precious little jewels she had rarely experienced as an idol- a day she could devote purely to herself! She was not going to waste one moment of it!

The only question was...where should she go? When she first arrived in town, she had been terrified to go out on her own. The chance that someone might recognize her was high. Fortunately Yu Narukami had been willing to show her around (doubly fortunate that he was super cool and good looking!). But Yu was hanging out with Yosuke and the other guys today, so that was out. And while she could go out with on of her other friends (Chie or Naoto could easily keep her safe, and Yukiko would be good company) today Rise wanted a little alone time. Surely all the buzz and excitement about Risette had died down enough that she could wander about safely? As a precaution she could along a nondescript coat and sunglasses.

That being done, the only question was where she would go.

The mad sounds of the city flooded into her perception as the doors to the bullet train opened. Rise emerged with the rest of the crowd, dressed in thick sunglasses, a wide brimmed hat, and a long overcoat. She wore her typical orange holter top and white khakis underneath. So far her little disguise was a total success!

Much as she loved the country, there was a part of her that missed the bustle of the big city. Shopping, glamour, bright lights, the hum of a million people rushing in every direction. Rise had grown up a country girl, her life full of quiet and mundane happenings. When she began her modeling career she had been in awe of the big city. No amount of show business could totally erase that simple delight and love for the city and the crowd. Much as she valued her time with the Investigators and her family she dearly missed the pleasure of strolling down the boulevard of a busy street.

"Sooooo....now that I'm here, what shall I do?" Rise asked herself, her eyes dancing up and down the street.

Shopping was always a popular pastime. Trying on clothes and the thrill of finding a valuable purchase were near and dear to Rise's heart, teenage sterotypes be damned. Perhaps something sexy to flaunt in front of Yu and the boys? Maybe something that would finally turn Kanji's head (seriously, what was up with that guy?). Maybe a new swim suit?

She suddenly stopped dead in her tracks. A familiar face stared enthusiastically back at her from a prominent billboard. "Kanamin Kitchen! Performing one night only! Feast your eyes on these delectable morsels as they serenade you toward your dreams" declared the poster under the image of Kanamin Mashita and her crew of performers. Rise had to laugh. Not too long ago Kanmin had been her coworker, a junior member of show business who looked up to her as a senpai and a friend. When Rise had quite being Risette the studio poured all their resources into Kanmin and her meat themed production. At one point Rise had been jealous of the attention the new girl was receiving. Okay, maybe she was still a LITTLE jealous. But she also admired how far her old friend had grown while Rise was on hiatus.

"In more ways than one, apparently. That has to be plastic surgery. There's no way those things are real! She could give Naoto a run for her mammaries." Rise thought, staring at the chest of her pseudo rival.

Hmmmm....she might just be able to grab a ticket if she was lucky. Maybe she should check out the concert? Nobody was gonna notice her in the dark and the crowd.

Darkness surrounded her, punctuated intermittently by beams of colorful light dancing through the shadows. The roar of the crowd was deafening, but it couldn't drown out the thrum of the music or the voice of Kanamin's band. Rise let her body move to the rthym, feeling as much as hearing the music pulse through her. Yes. This was what she had needed. The perfect way to pass her day. The intense feeling of the music seeming to replace the beating of her heart, the heat and press of the crowd, the room alive with energy. She had forgotten how much she loved it. In those moments especially it was possible to forget who she was and simply meld into the sound and the crowd and bask in the shared experience. She had loved that as an idol, and she was finding it so much better as a spectator. All the fun and glory. None of the bullshit. Granted, it was fun to be the center of attention, but right now it was better to be annoymous, just another face in the crowd, who she was impossible to guess in the dark and the-

"That's soooooo cool! I have to tweet about this!" Shiki said.

"But no one is going to believe this otherwise!" The man protested.

The man shrugged, but his girlfriend looked unconvinced. Then a rather evil looking smile appeared on her face.

"What do we get out of it?" Shiki asked.

"Errr....you can say you got to talk with Risette in person?" Rise offered.

"I dunno. Sounds kinda lame. I mean, you are the one asking for the favor. Its not our fault you decided to sneak in here...." Shiki said in mock skeptism.

Rise sighed. "You have something particular in mind? An autograph?"

Shiki smiled. "I'll pass. But now that you mention it....I really like those shoes."

"My....shoes?" Rise asked, caught off guard.

"Uh-huh. You have good taste. I bet they're pretty expensive, too."

Rise muttered to herself.

"Good luck, Mrs. Risette! We won't say a word. Might wanna figure out what to do about them, though."

"She must really want to stay anonymous if she gave away her shoes like that!" said another.

"What'll you give us to stay quiet?" asked a third.

"I could... give you autographs?" Rise offered. "I'll sign whatever you'd like! Nobody could argue that you didn't see me if you had my autograph!"

How they could hear each other whispering over the booming sound of the concert was unknown to Rise, but she wasn't going to start asking questions right now. The only thing that mattered was getting out of this little predicament with as little attention drawn to her as possible.

"Okay, we've talked it over." the apparent head of the group said as the huddle broke. "We'll accept your autographs for our silence."

"Oh, that's great! If one of you could just give me a pen, I'll-" Rise began.

One article for each of them... that would leave her with just her coat and sunglasses! Possibly a single sock as well if they were going to consider each one a separate article. There was no way Rise could possibly comply with that!

Stuffing her hands in her coat pockets, she found some relief in feeling that her personal belongings were still with her, phone and wallet included. It was good that she was able to keep her personal belongings from those leeches, at the very least.

Rise's only hope of escape from this mess was just across the platform, but with a large crowd of people blocking her path as they went about their business. On any other day it would be a minor annoyance, but under her current condition...

Still, this was no time for hesitation! She'd be stuck like this for much longer if she failed to get on that train. So, with one arm clutching her jacket tightly and the other in front of her to make some space, Rise walked right on through the crowd.

That flaw was that in her current position she could not sit down or use a handhold to steady herself. This had not been a problem as the train increased speed, but of course as it neared its next stop it had to slow down. And physics being what it was....

But as much as it pleases me to see you deliver those humiliations to others, I love to see them forced upon you still more. This is the price of my help, and the consequence of your lies. NOW STRIP!"

Enjoy being plain old Sarah for a time, a powerless, sniveling, ordinary little girl. The memory of your nudity will fade from everyone's minds with time, of course, as it always does. But for now, enjoy the humiliations you have given to so many. We can speak of your reward when I deem your suffering has been sufficient. Good bye, little girl."

The rabbit vanished, leaving Sarah standing in the middle of a small town completely naked.

Almost immediately, Sarah heard the cries of shock, surprise, disgust, and amusement. Sure enough, the naked foreigner was an instant spectacle, her healthy chest bouncing freely in the sunlight, while her round buttocks jiggled lightly with every step. Okay, people are seeing me. I know that's what you want, you jackass! Sarah screamed in her head. Are you happy now?

1422.content:
As a group decision, they were trying a different beach than usual. One that was larger, a bit more populated, and better stocked with amenities to spend an entire day there, as opposed to the slim pickings of their usual spot. It meant a longer trip by scooter but Yosuke, who originally suggested the location, assured them that it would be worth it. And it looked like it would be, as the team first set their eyes on this new location. However, they weren't expecting there to be a fenced off entrance guarded by a belligerent lifeguard.

He was what one would expect a lifeguard to look like: tall, short-haired, skin glistening in the midday sun, and cutting a powerful figure in his tanktop and speedo, a whistle hanging from a cord wrapped around his neck. "Hold up," he said, stopping the group's advance. "Only swimsuits or proper beach attire are allowed past here."

"What?" Naoto asked. "Why?"

"A while back there were some kids who nearly drowned here, all because they were a little to close to the water and weren't prepared for a sudden tide increase. Turned out they couldn't swim. So now, no swimmers are allowed past here at all."

"Whoa, seriously?" Chie gasped. "Way to pick 'em Yosuke."

A feeling of dread began to spread through the group.

"Hey, this is news to me too!" Yosuke shot back, feeling the team's glares. "Nothing about this came up in the advertising."

"It's not something we like to talk about, for obvious reasons," the lifeguard shrugged.

"But, wait, what does that have to do with swimsuits?" Rise asked.

"Well, I personally am not proud of this, but," the lifeguard said, lowering his voice and leaning in towards the group. "We used to give everyone a swim test for entry before, but due to complaints that got revoked, but there were safety concerns, so we made this compromise. If you're wearing a swimsuit, then you should be able to know how to swim. From there, it's normal beach safety issues. It's perfect logic."

"No it isn't. That way of thinking is highly flawed," Naoto stated, shaking her head. "Take me for example: I can swim, I just don't have a swimsuit."

"Then you can't pass," said the lifeguard.

"You don't have a swimsuit, Nao-chan?" Teddie asked, surprised. "Then, do you swim bear-"

"No!" Naoto shut off Teddie before he could say what he, and undoubtedly everyone else was thinking by the looks on their faces. "I don't have one because I was not even planning on going swimming," Naoto said sternly.

"Swimsuits only past this point," the lifeguard reiterated. The group started to protest, but the lifeguard cut them off. "Sorry, kids, I don't make the rules, I just enforce them."

"That wasn't on the advertising either..." Yosuke grumbled, once again suffering the glares of the girls.

"Well, works for me!" Teddie said, springing out of his bear suit and stepping out with his human body, already dressed in swimming trunks. With a shrug, the rest of the team followed, having worn their swimsuits underneath their clothes also.

Naoto grumbled and turned away as they did so. Just how was her current attire not fit for the beach anyways? Sure it wasn't a swimsuit, but her casual short-sleeved button-up shirt, a t-shirt underneath, and a pair of shorts with sandals should be light enough to serve as a substitute without much difficulty! And yet that was considered too much. Maybe she should just strip down to her undergarments there and now and pass them off as swimwear?

Naoto considered the possibility for just a moment before shaking the foolish notion out of her head. One, she just told him that she did not have a swimsuit, and two, she was not going to humiliate herself like that just for a chance at a day at the beach.

"And after all that way... Sorry, guess that's just how it is, Naoto," Kanji said sympathetically.

Naoto looked at the worried faces of her friends, and realized that her frustration was still apparent.

"It's fine," Naoto said, regaining her composure. "There's bound to be a swimsuit shop back in the city somewhere. I'll just catch up with all of you later. Shouldn't take more than an hour."

"Wait a minute, what's that?" Yu asked, pointing at a shack behind the gate.

"That's our emergency beach shop. Sells important beach supplies, such as towels, umbrellas, sunscreen, and even swimsuits."

"Really? Then can I at least go there and buy a swimsuit to change into?" Naoto asked.

"Nope, can't enter the beach if you don't have a swimsuit."

"What?" Naoto asked, the combined frustration of her comrades echoing around her. "What possible service could such a shop serve if it is stuck behind the gate?"

"Accidents can happen at the ocean. It's better to be prepared, just in case," the lifeguard said mysteriously.

"But can't we go?" Yu asked. "There's nothing stopping us from buying a swimsuit and bringing it back, right? We're clearly wearing swimsuits after all."

"Huh..." the lifeguard considered this briefly. "Don't see why not."

"Ooo! Ooo!" Teddie jumped, cheering. "I'll do it!"

"Oh no you don't!" Chie growled, holding him back. "Who knows what crazy thing you would end up choosing?"

"But I'm the only one who knows Nao-chan's measurements, remember? You might get something too small!" Teddie grinned.

"Hey, I got to see those too, remember, Teddie?" Rise said, joining Chie in in holding him back. "You're not needed here."

Naoto flushed crimson. Why did they have to bring that up!? This was already embarrassing enough as it was. "Look, just, all of you go!" Naoto shouted at them. "I think Yukiko-senpai would appreciate your help more than I would right now!"

The struggling trio stopped to see Yukiko having gone ahead of them, floundered in surprise, and then clamored off after her towards the shop.

Naoto and the others remained where they were in silence. The guys looked nervous, and Naoto herself was feeling a little guilty, having caused all this indirectly due to her beach habits. Soon enough though, Yukiko and her group returned, proudly holding an item, presumably the swimsuit, in her hands. "We're back!" she called.

"Thank you," Naoto said, taking the suit into her hands. "I hope that wasn't too much trouble."

"Not at all, Naoto-kun," Rise said, smiling.

"Yeah," Teddie added. "When it comes to Nao-chan, no expense is too great for Yosuke's wallet."

"Wait, WHAT!?" Yosuke gasped, patting his pockets, his face paling. "Again!? When did he-? And you just let him!?"

"Hey, this was your idea, and we left our stuff outside," Chie argued. "Look, We'll pay you back when we get back, okay?"

As Yosuke and Chie began to argue, Naoto took the time to head into a changing booth and get changed. What a mess this all was... But at least they would all be able to finally get into the beach and enjoy themselves, now that she had a swimsuit; though she'd much rather spend the day in her own clothes... but it was clear that that was not going to be an option by this point.

Eager to get on with the day, Naoto had taken off everything, including her underwear, before actually regarding the swimsuit Yukiko had given her, noticing for the first time that it was-

14222.content:
"Ugh, Yukiko..." Naoto groaned.

It was indeed a bikini, Naoto realized as the top came separate out of the pile. Dark blue in color, she could already tell that the two pieces would not be covering much of her, which made her nervous. Not only would it leave her gender unambiguous and easily apparent for everyone to see, but she also felt uncomfortable wearing such scanty clothes, especially if she was going to be stared at. She couldn't even make it through the swimsuit portion of that damned beauty pageant Yosuke signed her and the girls up for back then!

But as much as Naoto wanted to pack it in, she remembered her friends and that the girls (plus Teddie), had picked this out for her. She couldn't just throw that back in their faces. And like it or not, she would have to conform to some kind of swimsuit so that they could get in... she could do this much for them at least.

Sighing, she put the bikini on, and was pleasantly surprised to find that it fit her perfectly, and seemed to be holding okay. And at least there was some decent coverage of her cleavage and bottom on this one, rather than some other swimsuits she had seen which were little more than strings and modesty triangles. She could probably make this work. Taking a deep breath, she opened the door and stepped back outside.

"Woohoo! Nao-chan!" Teddie cheered.

"N-Naoto!" Kanji stammered. "You, um, you-"

"You look amazing, Naoto-kun!" Rise cheered as well, along with other encouraging remarks from the rest of the team.

"T-Thanks," Naoto said, already feeling embarrassed. She was standing firm, not wasnting to be shaken, but that would be easier if the guys would pick up their jaws from the ground. Even Yu looked flustered, for goodness sakes!

"We were hoping it would work," said Yukiko. "They didn't have anything else in your size, so we were hoping this would be okay. And with a two-piece, we all match!... Um, kind of, at least. Do you like it?"

"It's... wonderful. Thank you, everyone." said Naoto, not wanting to disappoint and knowing that it could have been worse.

"All right!" said Chie. "We're all in swimsuits now. No more problems letting us in, right?" she addressed the lifeguard.

"Oh, um, yeah, sure," the lifeguard replied, startlingly more polite. "Again, I'm sorry if I er, inconvenienced you in any way, um, Miss. I mean, I probably should have let you in to shop, since you were in need and all, but, you know, the rules-"

"Stop. It's fine," Naoto said, leveling her voice. Amazing how much more cooperative you are now than before... she thought bitterly.

With that obstacle out of their way, the swimsuit-clad Investigation Team entered the beach and soon found a spot and set on up. There were others at the beach, but not too many, and thankfully none of them were staring their way, everyone all swept up in their own activities. Naturally, after some boasting by Yosuke that he was right on the money, the discussion turned to what to do next, and everyone decided to do their own things for a bit. Teddie decided to canvass the beach for some "hot babes," and Yosuke followed suit, partly to join in and partly to make sure that Teddie wouldn't do something that ended up in them all getting thrown out. Rise pulled Yu down over to the shoreline with a glint in her eye and a mischievous smile... they would probably be gone a while. Then, Yukiko realized she was hungry, so she and Chie headed over to the snack shop, leaving the young detective alone with Kanji.

"Looks like it's just the two of us," Naoto said.

"Uh, yeah," Kanji answered.

"Everyone else seems to have decided except for us. Was there something you wished to do, Kanji-kun?" Naoto asked.

"To do? You mean, together?" Kanji asked, sounding surprised.

"If you'd like," Naoto shrugged. "I mean, everyone else has paired up as well, and I'm open for pretty much anything. But if there was something you wanted to do on your own, please do not let me be a hindrance. I was just planning on reading right here for a while if that is the case."

"Oh, well, I uh... AH! I just realized I forgot to eat this morning. Gotta get some grub!" he stammered, then sped off toward the snack shop.

"Hm, I guess reading it is, then," Naoto shrugged, sitting down on a towel and opening her book, eager to pick up where she left off. It was probably best this way. She was almost at the climax where the detective was about to confront-

"Hey!"

Naoto had only made it a few pages before she was interrupted. It was Chie, with a mostly-eaten steak croquette in her mouth. "Just sitting here all by yourself?"

"Yes," Naoto answered. "Kanji was here before but he-"

"Just stormed to the snack line all nervous and red in the face? Yeah..." Chie sighed.

"I knew it..." Naoto groaned, hunching over to conceal her well-framed bust.

"Hey, it's not your fault. Kanji's always been that nervous around you even in your normal clothes, you know? It's probably just cause you were alone together," Chie said, finishing up her food and tossing the skewer on their stuff. "Hm... Tell you what, how about we get Yukiko and Kanji with us and then we all go do something so we can start having fun here and forget all about that scummy lifeguard."

"Well, I suppose since I am wearing a swimsuit I should make the most of this, and a group activity may ease Kanji's nerves," said Naoto, uncurling herself and setting her book aside. "All right, I'm in. What do you suggest?"

"Okay!" Chie grinned. "How about we all go-"

Instead, she felt it would be nice to sit on the shore instead and relax, possibly catching up on some reading in the meantime while everyone else swam. So, instead of wearing swimming clothes like everyone else, she showed up in her regular fall-weather clothes to stay warm in the brisk air. "Yes, I am," Naoto answered warily. "And you a-"

"Man, talk about good luck, running into such a famous person here!" the boy said, taking the girl's hands and looking into her face, sporting a huge grin.

"I know, right?" the girl replied, mirroring his expression. "And with all that stuff he's sitting next to... Do you think he's on a case? Maybe a stakeout? Or-"

"Actually, I am not in the middle of anything at the moment," Naoto interjected, standing up to address them. info.description:
The women of the Persona 4 game find themselves subjected to ENF situations, much to their displeasure. Follow and guide their paths as they try desperately to regain their modesty in the face of unfavorable odds.

A brief guide to the women of Inaba:

Chie Satonaka (http://megamitensei.wikia.com/wiki/Chie_Satonaka): An upbeat, short-tempered martial artist and best friend of Yukiko Amagi. A bit of a tomboy, Chie still does care about her appearance and is easily offended by suggestions that she isn't feminine.

Yukiko Amagi (http://megamitensei.wikia.com/wiki/Yukiko_Amagi): Wealthy, elegant, and introverted, Yukiko is the heiress to the famed Amagi Inn. A great deal of her free time is spent working at her family inn, preparing to deal with inheriting the establishment. Yukiko is the object of a great deal of unrequited affection in her school.

Rise Kujikawa (http://megamitensei.wikia.com/wiki/Rise_Kujikawa): A recently retired idol, Rise is brimming with energy and enthusiasm almost constantly. Cheery and sociable, Rise is quite used to being the center of attention, though that doesn't mean it never makes her uncomfortable.

Naoto Shirogane (http://megamitensei.wikia.com/wiki/Naoto_Shirogane): The "Detective Prince", renowned for her brilliant and deductive mind. She largely rejects her femininity, preferring to dress and speak as a man and doing her best to hide her figure. While her appearance doesn't suggest it, there are hints that Naoto's figure is far more developed than she lets on.

Social Links and side characters: Far too numerous to easily list here.
